DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Studying sample blood patient cancer laboratory may help doctor predict whether patient undergo donor stem cell transplant develop acute graft-versus-host disease . PURPOSE : This clinical trial study T cell see well help predict acute graft-versus-host disease patient undergo donor stem cell transplant .
DOC.brief_title: T Cells Predicting Acute Graft-Versus-Host Disease Patients Undergoing Donor Stem Cell Transplant
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To determine association regulatory T-lymphocyte ( Treg ) subsets present engraftment day 28 incidence acute graft-versus-host-disease ( aGVHD ) patient undergo allogeneic stem cell transplantation . - To identify gut-homing skin-homing Treg subset determine role engraftment day 28 predictor gut skin aGVHD , respectively . OUTLINE : Patients undergo blood sample collection time neutrophil engraftment prior stem cell transplant ( SCT ) post-SCT day 7 , 14 , 21 , 28 day allogeneic stem cell transplantation . Blood sample analyze T-cell subset percentage regulatory T-lymphocyte ( Treg ) T-cell subset express specific home receptor gut skin via flow cytometry . Patients ' medical record also review periodically .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Patients undergo allogeneic SCT Age > = 18 year Exclusion criterion : Inability give informed consent Patients receive allogeneic SCT Any condition , opinion investigator , might interfere study objective Any reason , opinion investigator , add additional risk patient
